item.title: How Linux System Boots up!
item.description: Power on BIOS: points to the bootloader (to multple select OS and to add more features) Loads kernel ​ run level 1: looks for devices through I/O ports (autoprobing) ​ handle control to Init Init Process ​ Check for filesystem and disk failures ​ start several daemons such as www server and print server ​ starts getty program to watch keyboards and mount inputs ​ daemons to support network services and x server.

item.title: Use your Ram wisely!
item.description: Limiting Ram usage by browsers using cgroups when I was running my old p4 system on 1 gb ram. I have been using my 12 year old pentium 4 processor computer with 1.5GB ram and 1 GB of swap for last month with debian 9. It works smooth, way smoother than Windows equivalent. But here’s a glitch, as soon as I start browsing, the memory consumption reaches the highest peak. My system starts to hang and slow down as long the browser is open.

item.title: What is your PASS-word?
item.description: Ever been frustated remembering so many password for so many services you signed up for, and sometimes only for one time use?
